Situation1: A heated dispute has escalated to the point where they are questioning staying together.
Expectation2: Follow safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries on site
Situation2: The carpenter should be on time in the work area
Story: I stared at my phone, my boyfriend’s last message still glowing on the screen: “We need to talk. I can’t keep doing this.” My heart pounded, the argument from last night replaying in my mind. He wanted me to come over, to talk things through, to prove that I cared enough to fix what was breaking between us. I knew if I didn’t go, it might be the end. But as I glanced at the clock, panic set in. My shift at the construction site started in twenty minutes, and I was already running late. If I didn’t show up on time, I’d be breaking the safety protocol—no one could start work until I was there to check the equipment. The crew depended on me to keep them safe, and any delay could mean someone getting hurt. My phone buzzed again, his words sharp and desperate. I felt torn in two, the weight of both worlds pressing down on me, each demanding something I wasn’t sure I could give.
